contentrichtext.text: {{TOCright}} '''Amr''' or '''AMR''' may refer to: ==Companies== * [[AMR (Abbingdon Music Research)]], a UK manufacturer of high-end audio systems * [[AMR Corporation]], parent company of American Airlines * [[American Medical Response]], a private ambulance operator * [[Arcata and Mad River Railroad]] * [[AMR Research]], a research company focused on the intersection of business processes with technology ==Information technology== * [[Audio/modem riser]] A slot on the motherboard that is the size of the PCIe x1 * [[Adaptive Multi-Rate audio codec]], a patented audio data compression scheme optimized for speech coding, the common file extension of which is <tt>.amr</tt> * [[Adaptive mesh refinement]], a method of adaptive meshing used in numerical analysis * [[Automatic meter reading]], the technology of automatically collecting data from water, gas electric meters * [[AMR radiotelephone network (Czechoslovakia)]] (in Czech, Automatizovaný městský radiotelefon), an early radio-telephone network in Czechoslovakia ==People== * [[Amr (name)]], an Arabic male given name ==Military== * [[AMR 35]], a French light tank * [[Anti-materiel rifle]], a large-calibre rifle capable of piercing thick armor * ''Atlantic Missile Range'', one of the previous names of the [[Eastern Range]] ==Other uses== * [[Advanced meat recovery]], a slaughterhouse process by which residual meat trimmings are extracted from bones and other carcass materials * [[Amarakaeri]], an indigenous American language, from its ISO 639 language code * [[Amersham station]], from its National Rail Code * Anisotropic [[Magnetoresistance]], a material property where impedance depends on external magnetic fields * Accelerating Moment Release, an [[Earthquake precursor]] signalling a major earthquake * [[Aston Martin Racing]], a British auto racing team run by Aston Martin and Prodrive {{disambig}}
